image.altText: Floral tributes line a police station railing alongside the words: POLICE ONLY, NO UNAUTHORISED ENTRY

props.synopsis: A Sydney-based law firm says it is representing the family of a 44-year-old Aboriginal woman who died in custody at the Tennant Creek police watch house.

title.children: Aboriginal mother-of-five identified after death in NT police watch house

image.altText: A man in a red shirt, walking away from the courthouse.

props.synopsis: A 61-year-old dual national charged over a fatal hit-and-run in Darwin has been granted bail, less than 10 days after the crash which claimed the life of a 27-year-old woman.

title.children: NT court grants bail for alleged hit-run driver, allows overseas travel

image.altText: two police officers walking down a deserted street from behind

props.synopsis: After years of negative headlines, crime rates in Alice Springs are showing signs of turning a corner but some locals remain worried the change could be short-lived.

title.children: Lower crime rates in Alice Springs leave many optimistic, others worried

image.altText: A general view ahead of the round 24 AFL match between Essendon Bombers and Carlton Blues at the MCG.

props.synopsis: Phoenix Spicer, who played 12 AFL matches for North Melbourne, has died at the age of 23.

title.children: Former North Melbourne AFL player Phoenix Spicer dies aged 23

image.altText: A road surrounded by water either side

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's Top End has been transformed into a lush green paradise by a cyclone and a monsoon that have brought an unusually heavy start to the annual wet season.

title.children: Top End dams overflow as parks come to life in the wake of Cyclone Fina

image.altText: A cricket batter holds up his helmet and bat in celebration of a century

props.synopsis: Australia leads England by 134 first-innings runs after a dominant day three at the SCG, puntuated by centuries to Travis Head and Steve Smith.

title.children: Aussie batters heap more pain on tiring England, eyeing final victory at the SCG

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, an older man with glasses in a black suit, looking stern while addressing the media.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese does not rule out calling a royal commission into the Bondi Beach terrorist attack, but says his immediate priority is the review of intelligence and security agencies.

title.children: PM doesn't rule out royal commission into Bondi terror attack

image.altText: A vehicle with a Happy Chanukah! sign that has sustained fire damage.

props.synopsis: A man is charged after an alleged arson attack on a vehicle with a Hanukkah decoration on Christmas morning in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Man charged in connection to alleged Hanukkah car arson in Melbourne

image.altText: Screens displaying the logo of Grok and its founder Elon Musk

props.synopsis: A digital undressing spree on Elon Musk's social media site has prompted investigations from countries including France, India and Malaysia.

title.children: EU, Britain condemn sexualised deepfake images spreading on X

image.altText: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. gestures as he speaks during the inaugural Make America Healthy Again summit in Washington in 2025.

props.synopsis: The US government takes the unprecedented step of cutting the number of vaccines it recommends for every child, a move long sought by Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr. But medical groups say it undermines protections against diseases.

title.children: Doctors slam US cut to vaccines recommended for children

image.altText: A man with white hair, and a black jumper, looking at the ASX stock market boards in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australian shares retreat into into the red, while steel producer BlueScope gains 20 per cent on a takeover tilt. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX runs out of steam despite Wall Street rally — as it happened

image.altText: BlueScope Steel signage.

props.synopsis: Kerry Stokes-controlled firm SGH has launched a $13.2 billion takeover bid for BlueScope Steel, in partnership with a US steelmaker.

title.children: BlueScope shares rocket higher on $13 billion Stokes bid

image.altText: Firefighters in yellow protective gear using a hose along the ground in front of a bright orange glow from nearby flames

props.synopsis: Australia's capital cities are increasingly at risk of being affected by a major fire like the one that ravaged Los Angeles last year, according to a new climate report.

title.children: LA-like fires could hit Australian capital cities, report warns

image.altText: Mickey Rourke at a red carpet event in a hoodie and sunglasses, The Lincoln Moor Company

props.synopsis: The actor, who faced accusations of homophobia and inappropriate behaviour on set last year, could now lose his home.

title.children: Mickey Rourke launches fundraiser to pay $89,000 in rent

image.altText: Father and daughter frontbench duo Monia and Damien Tudehope

props.synopsis: The opposition leader says she does not consider the gender breakdown of her shadow ministry, which has 16 men and 10 women.

title.children: Father and daughter to sit on NSW opposition frontbench

image.altText: man standing outdoors on farm

props.synopsis: A Scenic Rim farmer says the costs of getting a council permit to host campers are so high he may have to sell his property.

title.children: Farmer considers selling up because of red tape on hosting campers

image.altText: A mother crouches down with her young daughter in front of a bookshelf

props.synopsis: Public libraries in Australia are experimenting with inventive ways to attract new members — but a lack of funding means they must do more with less.

title.children: Libraries have bounced back after COVID. Here's how they did it

image.altText: Blonde woman wearing red T-shirt and jeans with arms up.

props.synopsis: Dozens of people from multiple states have come forward after allegedly falling victim to a new pet and house-sitting scam orchestrated by career con artist Patricia McIntyre.

title.children: Serial fraudster allegedly targeting pet and home owners in scam

image.altText: Council workers remove saplings from sand dunes

props.synopsis: A Queensland council is being criticised for uprooting unauthorised saplings from sand dunes amid a long-running vegetation battle.

title.children: Rebel tree planters' work removed after beachfront poisonings

image.altText: Heidelberg sinkhole

props.synopsis: The sudden collapse of a sinkhole in Melbourne's north-east left residents shocked on Tuesday. Here's an explanation of how and why they form.

title.children: Sinkholes could be forming for years before a sudden collapse. Here's why

image.altText: Madison Keys clenches her fist

props.synopsis: Defending Australian Open champion Madison Keys got her Australian summer off to winning start with a straight-sets victory at the Brisbane International.

title.children: Defending Aus Open champion Keys off to a flier with Brisbane win

image.altText: A smiling blond man in a work shirt stands in a garage.

props.synopsis: Fourteen years after Charlie Park disappeared in regional WA, detectives have reopened the case and are calling for information from the community.

title.children: Ominous graffiti revealed as police probe 2012 disappearance of WA man

image.altText: A pink substance in the beach tide.

props.synopsis: Scientists say a bioluminescent algae causes the red tides at the centre of recent environmentalist concerns — but that's not to say the magnificent display is totally harmless to marine life.

title.children: Is Tasmania's 'red tide' a brilliant light show or an environmental problem?

image.altText: An older woman teaches a younger woman how to knit

props.synopsis: In a country town near Canberra, a program run by an aged care provider and the local high school is seeing positive results in breaking down barriers between younger and older community members.

title.children: A 70-year age gap is no barrier to friendship in this town

image.altText: A man sitting at a table.

props.synopsis: Australia's energy prices continue to soar as questions continue to be raised about the actions of providers, including by this pensioner who was overcharged and then had debt collectors chasing him.

title.children: How a 'ruthless' energy company went after a pensioner for money he didn't owe

image.altText: A man in a check shirt leans on a gate

props.synopsis: South Australian independent MP Nick McBride says he will run for re-election, as he remains on home detention after spending 10 days behind bars for an alleged assault against his wife.

title.children: SA MP charged for alleged assault will contest the upcoming state election

image.altText: A picture of Megan Tangye who died December 28.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the death of 31-year-old Megan Tangye, who died hours after she was taken to hospital on the NSW Mid North Coast last month.

title.children: Family mourn 'beautiful soul' as police probe woman's suspicious death

image.altText: drawing of a young girl using the phone in bed at night, next to an image of a man on a laptop in a hoodie.

props.synopsis: Child safety experts say the case of a 13-year-old girl who became pregnant while in state care highlights the dangers of the residential system.

title.children: Teenage girl sexually assaulted and pregnant while in state care

image.altText: A lifesaver watches over Main Beach on North Stradbroke Island.

props.synopsis: Surf lifesavers are rethinking their iconic beach safety message after multiple drownings at remote or unpatrolled swim spots in NSW.

title.children: Swimmers told to take pool noodle to remote beaches after drownings

image.altText: Keaon Koloamatangi runs the ball for the Kangaroos against England in 2025.

props.synopsis: Dragons supporters will have to wait until 2027 to see Keaon Koloamatangi wearing the Red V, but the club describes his signing as the "biggest" in their recent history.

title.children: Dragons sign star Rabbitohs forward on massive five-year deal

image.altText: Fire engulfs Wynnum home

props.synopsis: Family escapes house fire 'by the skin of their teeth' thanks to their dog who raised the alarm.

title.children: Family escapes fire 'by the skin of their teeth' thanks to pet dog

image.altText: Close up of Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: A number of communities remain on flood watch, while a traveller is in hospital after walking through knee-deep mud after he became bogged in outback Queensland on Saturday.

title.children: PM announces $38 million for flood-affected north-west Qld communities

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann takes his appeal to the High Court against the findings that he, on the balance of probabilities, raped Brittany Higgins in 2019.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann launches High Court appeal in latest defamation battle round

image.altText: A woman with glasses looks at the camera in front of a huge monstera plant in a rattan vase

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people have accessed South Australia's Donor Conception Register in its first year, lifting decades of secrecy surrounding anonymous donations — an outcome that has prompted calls from a leading advocate for similar moves at national level.

title.children: Katherine may have 700 half-siblings. She's trying to find them to pass on medical advice
